name: Scribd
short_description:
Scribd is a digital library, featuring e-book subscription services on iPhone,
iPad, Kindle Fire and Nook Tablet.
long_description:
Scribd is the premier subscription reading service with more than 500,000
titles, including New York Times bestsellers, classics, and reader favorites in
every genre. A pioneer of the all-you-can-read model, Scribd's subscriptions
service allows readers to have unlimited access to more than 500,000 books from
nearly 1,000 publishers, including Harper Collins, [Simon &
Schuster](/organization/simon-schuster), Open Road Media, [Lonely
Planet](/organization/lonely-planet), National Geographic, Rosetta,
[Workman](/workman-publishing), Wiley and more. Launched in 2007 by [Trip
Adler](/person/john-adler) and [Jared Friedman](/person/jared-friedman) in [San
Francisco, CA](/location/san-francisco/528f5e3c90d111115d1c2e4ff979d58e), Scribd
is backed by [Y Combinator](/organization/y-combinator), [Charles River
Ventures](/organization/charles-river-ventures), and [Redpoint
Ventures](/organization/redpoint-ventures). Scribd has more than 80 million
active readers visiting the site each month, and its document reader has been
embedded more than 10 million times across the web on sites like [The New York
Times](/organization/newyorktimes), [USA Today](/organization/usa-today),
Guardian, and [TechCrunch](/organization/techcrunch).
